original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close up, but turnover remains low
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed up on Tuesday, CSE data showed. Turnover remained low at 335 million.
The All Share Price Index was up 0.28 percent, or 30.12 points, at 10,684.
The S&P SL20 index was down 0.52 percent, or 16.00 points, at 3,084.
Associated Motor Finance Company Plc saw the most trade volumes and closed up at 18.40.
Top positive contributors to the ASPI were Ceylon Tobacco Company Plc (up at 993.50), Commercial Bank of Ceylon Plc (up at 96.90) Melstacorp Plc (up at 85.90). (Colombo/Jan2/2024).
